issue.title: [PDTS] Better to avoid deriving from std::iterator

discussion.p: Although the Standard has made this mistake almost a dozen times, I recommend not depicting directory_iterator and recursive_directory_iterator as deriving from std::iterator, since that's a binding requirement on implementations. Instead they should be depicted as having the appropriate typedefs, and leave it up to implementers to decide how to provide them. (The difference is observable to users with is_base_of, not that they should be asking that question.)
